revised_title: Stark Intensities in Canal-Ray Sources at Different Pressures
tldr: This article investigates the effect of different gas pressures on the intensities of hydrogen and helium components in a canal-ray source. The author finds that at low pressures, the Stark intensities observed by Mark and Wierl are confirmed, but at high pressures, a new intensity distribution appears. The author explains this phenomenon and provides an experimental setup to study these effects.
